Name: Colorful Stool Made for a Child
Description: Compared with other stools that were found in the tomb of Tutankhamun, this one is remarkable. Because of its size, this stool appears to have been made for a child. It is of ordinary rush-work covered with plain linen and enriched with many complicated and brilliant colors. It is decorated with two bounding lions and the sign of Unification of the Two Lands.
